Posts.Content: Just thought I would share this. Hope it helps somebody. After being diagnosed last year, dbl. mast., lots of chemo, she's considered 'free' and ready for plastic surgery and a new outlook. We went to see the surgeon today. He looked at the wife's chart to refresh his memory. Asked a few questions. Got down to the nitty gritty; "You had a double masectomy?" "Yes" "You're getting reconstruction?" "Yes." "Both breasts?" "??????" I said " It looks like we have to pick either a left or a right?" doc "huh?????????????????" Wife " I quess I could just get one in the middle." doc "Huh?????????????" Me " Well, since we're looking at alternatives, maybe we could also get a pair on her back so I have something to do when hugging her" doc "Huh??????????????" Real blank look on his face. The nusres were still laughing when we left an hour later.
